Row.Text: Svesta has been a trading hub, defined by commerce and its long-standing mercantile dominance for most of its history. It is ideally situated on the Svestan peninsula to trade with both island and continental cities, with a well developed navy to defend its countless cargo ships as they sail the Klonoan sea. But that changed with the coming of Argast the Conquerer. Now Argastinium stretches across the continent, and Svesta stands alone on the mainland against him. Now all that keeps the dogs of war at bay are Svesta's lucrative trade routes; Argast is reluctant to destroy them, and the goods his newly conquered people favor, in a costly siege. He is content to wait until Svesta is weakened from within. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Numydian Federation, formerly a group of independent island city states, have banded together in the hopes of staving off Argast's conquest. But now their attempts to coerce Svesta into their league have collapsed after the Svestans refused to be subject to crippling trade agreements. Disagreement devolved into a war that has ravaged both civilizations' navies for several years, with no end in sight. Neither side will back down, but both worry they are only weakening one another before Argast sweeps through and conquers them all. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]But Argastinium is far from unassailable. The Cyats, an eclectic civilization of religious fanatics, have arrived from the east. Their foreign religion brings strange and powerful boons to those who follow it, capable of uprooting cities in rebellion and turning them to the Cyat cause. Already Argast has declared war on the Cyats in an attempt to stamp out their religious fervor, but has been as yet unsuccessful. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Svesta has reached a pivotal moment in its history. Locked into war with the Numydian Federation, you must defend the trade routes that prevent siege and inevitable conquest at the hands of Argast. Numydian rebels swarm the Svestan countryside, occupying your continental forces. Meanwhile, the Cyat faith begins to take hold in your land. If its majority is secured, your people will rise up and join the Cyat cause, only to be slain by Argast in yet another way. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Can you balance the necessities for trade, army, navy, and religion? Can you stand against Argast the Conqueror and live to tell the tale?
